author: manunlp
content:
Actually I don't know how to run at the same time Teku in INFO and LH in DEBUG.
When I remove `global_log_level` from `network_params`, it seems Kurtosis sets explicitly the INFO level debug for all nodes.
So when I set `--debug-level=debug` for LH, it complains:
```
the argument '--debug-level <LEVEL>' cannot be used multiple times
```
(It turns out on prysm you can set at the same time `--verbosity=info` AND `--verbosity=debug`, and in this case DEBUG wins.)

==> <@199561711278227457> , did you achieve to run Teku in INFO and LH in DEBUG?
(Reminder, we want Teku to be in INFO since it emits a lot of logs in DEBUG.)

author: manunlp
content:
Additional question for Teku:
When does the log `Received block for slot <n>` is printed?
I'm asking because in my analysis, I assumed that if this log were not printed, then the beacon node did not received the block.

However, I have this case:

```
2024-09-08 14:00:34.202 INFO  - Created availabilityChecker for slot 327
2024-09-08 14:00:34.202 INFO  - Starting data availability check for slot 327
2024-09-08 14:00:34.202 INFO  - Requested checkDataAvailability for 0xce60fff4ac3c0c4c626db51afd4eeef796bc2884556050b692b2c93d180e902c(327)
2024-09-08 14:00:34.212 INFO  - [nyota] DataColumnSidecarDB.addSidecar: new slot: 327, prevSlot count: 4, total added: 1291, finalizedSlot: 287
2024-09-08 14:00:34.214 INFO  - Collected block ce60ff..902c (327), index 23, 1st cell 00000000000000, commitments 6, proofs 6,block ce60ff..902c (327), index 55, 1st cell 00000000000000, commitments 6, proofs 6,block ce60ff..902c (327), index 80, 1st cell 0c3323a01173ea, commitments 6, proofs 6,block ce60ff..902c (327), index 98, 1st cell 56f17efac9a099, commitments 6, proofs 6 DataColumnSidecars in checkDataAvailability for 0xce60fff4ac3c0c4c626db51afd4eeef796bc2884556050b692b2c93d180e902c(327)
2024-09-08 14:00:34.234 INFO  - Availability check slot 327 result: DataAndValidationResult{validationResult=VALID, dataSize=4, cause=Optional.empty}
2024-09-08 14:00:36.001 INFO  - Slot Event  *** Slot: 327, Block: ... empty, Justified: 9, Finalized: 8, Peers: 5
```

There is no log `Received block for slot 327`.
However there is the log `Collected block ce60ff..902c (327)` (and `ce60ff...` does correspond to the block at slot 327.
How is this possible?

author: jimmygchen
content:

author: dmitriishmatko
content: Collected .. is only about DataColumns, `block` word there is a bit confusing (it refers to the block DataColumn is linked with), but it kicks in after receiving block, so block should be received

author: dmitriishmatko
content: I've checked the code, "Received block for slot" is a line only when Teku is proposer

author: dmitriishmatko
content:
`2024-09-08 14:00:34.202 INFO  - Requested checkDataAvailability for 0xce60fff4ac3c0c4c626db51afd4eeef796bc2884556050b692b2c93d180e902c(327)`
is initiated in ForkChoice when importing the block, so it's received

author: manunlp
content:
Oh OK, thanks. (That's quite a bit misleading.)
So my analysis based on the assumption "No `received block for slot <n>` printed = no block received" is quite wrong.
So it may change a lot of stuffs in my document ==> I re-put in in draft.
